intro: Satureja acinos f. albiflora, commonly known as whiteflower savory, is a rare and fragrant plant belonging to the Lamiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, pale yellow to white flowers and aromatic, needle-like leaves. Native to the Mediterranean region, it thrives in rocky and well-drained soils. The plant is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it contributes to the biodiversity of these ecosystems. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a delicate species requiring careful conservation efforts.
